snippet: A Yemeni money exchange was lauded for providing a crucial service even as terrorists reigned. But its dealings with Al Qaeda have put it in the cross hairs of the United States....
abstract: United States government designates Yemeni bank Al Omgy Brothers Money Exchange as having provided 'financial services to or in support of ' terrorist group Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula; company's owners say they had no option but to do business with group after it seized southern Yemen in 1015.

byline.original: By SAEED AL-BATATI and BEN HUBBARD
byline.contributor: Saeed Al-Batati reported from Al Shihr, and Ben Hubbard from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: A Yemeni money exchange was lauded for providing a crucial service even as terrorists reigned. But its dealings with Al Qaeda have put it in the cross hairs of the United States.

headline.main: Yemeni Bankers Get in Trouble Over a Customer, Al Qaeda
headline.print_headline: Bank Defends Dealing With Al Qaeda When It Called the Shots

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula
